Key Match Events: The Braves lost a 4-0 lead but rallied for four runs in the 10th inning to secure a 5th win in 6 games.
Raisel Iglesias blew his first save since May 3, allowing a game-tying hit to Trevor Larnach in the 8th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Brian Snitker commented on the win, stating, 'That’s a good win. It was going to be a costly loss, quite honestly. Now, it’s a good win.'
Travis d'Arnaud discussed his approach in clutch situations, saying, 'I don’t try to do too much. I just try to stay up the middle and if it happens, it happens.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves have now won eight of their last 10 games.
The Braves will send NL Cy Young candidate Chris Sale to the mound on Wednesday night as they look to sweep the Twins.
Others: The Braves' red-hot closer, Raisel Iglesias, had not allowed a hit since July 27, a span of 13 innings in 11 appearances before the game-tying hit by Trevor Larnach.
